ul.li1: 1Ah, destroyer, and yourself not destroyed!
ul.li2: And treacherous one, and no one has dealt treacherously with him!Many manuscripts suggest “you” rather than “him”
ul.li1: When you ceaseLiterally “finishing” destroying, you will be destroyed.
ul.li2: When you stop dealing treacherously, one will deal treacherously with you.
ul.li1: 2Yahweh, be gracious to us, we wait for you.
ul.li2: Be ourHebrew “their” arm in the mornings,
indeed our salvation in the time of trouble.
ul.li1: 3At the sound of tumult, peoples fled;
ul.li2: because of your exaltation, nations scattered.
ul.li1: 4And your spoil is gathered,
ul.li2: as the gathering of the locust,
ul.li3: as a swarm of locusts storming on it.
ul.li1: 5Yahweh is exalted, for he dwells on high;
ul.li2: he filled Zion with justice and righteousness,
ul.li1: 6and he will be the security of your times,
ul.li2: an abundance of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge.

chapter.p: The fear of Yahweh is his treasure.

ul.li1: 7Look! Their heroes cry out in the street;
ul.li2: the messengers of peace weep bitterly.
ul.li1: 8Highways are deserted;
ul.li2: the traveler on the road ceases.
ul.li1: One breaks a treaty,
ul.li2: he rejects the cities,A Dead Sea Scroll reads “witnesses”
he does not hold man in high regard.
ul.li1: 9The land mourns; it languishes.
ul.li2: Lebanon feels abashed; it withers.
ul.li1: Sharon is like the desert,
ul.li2: and Bashan and Carmel are losing their leaves.Literally “shaking off”
ul.li1: 10“Now I will arise,” says Yahweh.
ul.li2: “Now I will lift myself up proudly;
now I will raise myself.
ul.li1: 11You conceive dry grass, you bring forth stubble;
ul.li2: your breath is a fire; it will consume you.
ul.li1: 12And the peoples will be burning to lime—
ul.li2: they are burned like thorns that have been cut down in the fire.
ul.li1: 13You who are far away, hear what I have done;
ul.li2: and you who are near, know my might!”
ul.li1: 14Sinners are afraid in Zion;
ul.li2: trembling has seized the godless:
ul.li1: “Who of us can liveLiterally “dwell as an alien” with devouring fire?
ul.li2: Who of us can liveLiterally “dwell as an alien” with everlasting consuming hearths?”
ul.li1: 15He who walks in righteousness
ul.li2: and speaks uprightness,
ul.li1: who rejects the gain of extortion,
ul.li2: who refusesLiterally “shakes his hand from the taking of” a bribe,
ul.li1: who stops up his earsHebrew “ear” from hearing bloodshedLiterally “blood”
ul.li2: and shuts his eyes from seeing evil.
ul.li1: 16That one will live on the heights;
ul.li2: the fortresses of rocks will be his refuge.
ul.li1: His food will be given;
ul.li2: his watersHebrew “water” will endure.
ul.li1: 17Your eyes will see the king in his beauty;
ul.li2: they will see a distant land.Literally “land of distance”
ul.li1: 18Your mindLiterally “heart” will meditate on the terror:
ul.li2: “Where is the one who counted?
ul.li1: Where is the one who weighed out?
ul.li2: Where is the one who counted the towers?”
ul.li1: 19You will not see the insolent people,
ul.li2: the people whose language is too obscure to understand,Literally “obscure of lip than to hear”
ul.li3: whose stammering of tongue cannot be understood.Literally “there is no understanding”
ul.li1: 20Look on Zion, the city of our appointed festivals!
ul.li2: Your eyes will see Jerusalem,
ul.li1: an undisturbed settlement,
ul.li2: a tent that is not moved.Literally “not he is loaded”
ul.li1: No one will ever pull out its tent pegs,
ul.li2: and none of its ropes will be torn in two.
ul.li1: 21Rather, there Yahweh will be mighty for us,
ul.li2: a place of rivers and broad streams,Literally “streams broad of hands”
ul.li1: a galley ship withOr “of” oarsHebrew “oar” cannot go in it,
ul.li2: and a mighty ship cannot pass through it.
ul.li1: 22For Yahweh is our judge; Yahweh is our lawgiver.
ul.li2: Yahweh is our king; he is the one who will save us.
ul.li1: 23Your riggings hang slack;
ul.li2: they do not hold the base of their mast firm,
ul.li3: they do not spread out the sail.
ul.li1: Then the prey of spoil in abundance will be divided;
ul.li2: the lame will take plunder.
ul.li1: 24And no inhabitant will say, “I am sick”;
ul.li2: the people who live in it, their iniquity will be taken away.
